snippet: The Treasury Department said Thursday that a communications firm with close ties to President Obama talked to the administration about allowing tax breaks for its corporate clients on more than $1 trillion in offshore revenues.
abstract: Treasury Dept says that SKDKnickerbocker, communications firm with close ties to Pres Obama, talked to administration about allowing tax breaks for its corporate clients on more than $1 trillion in offshore revenues; firm has insisted that it never lobbied senior Treasury officials.

headline.main: Treasury Says Firm Discussed Tax Break
headline.print_headline: Treasury Says Firm Discussed Tax Break

byline.original: By ERIC LICHTBLAU and ERIC LIPTON

snippet: Microsoft, the world’s best-known software company, is set to begin selling a tablet computer on Friday, a move that is ruffling the feathers of its partners.
abstract: Microsoft, world’s best-known software company, is set to begin selling its own tablet computer, first PC it has produced in its 37-year history; shift has unnerved some of Microsoft's hardware partners, who have few other compelling software alternatives.

headline.main: A New Tablet Puts Microsoft in a Delicate Position
headline.print_headline: A Tablet Puts Microsoft In a Delicate Position

snippet: The biggest factor in the company's stock price this week seemed to be Apple, which for more than a month has been rumored to be working on a competing Internet radio service.
abstract: The biggest factor in the company's stock price this week seemed to be Apple, which for more than a month has been rumored to be working on a competing Internet radio service.

headline.main: A Week of Market Fluctuations for Pandora

snippet: Apple’s profits were buoyed by sales of its new iPhone, which was introduced nine days before the quarter’s end.
abstract: Apple reports fiscal fourth-quarter net income of $8.22 billion, or $8.67 a share, compared with $6.62 billion, or $7.05 a share, in year-ago quarter; attributes gains to  surge in sales of the iPhone, product that now accounts for nearly half the company's sales.

headline.main: Apple Profit Rises 24% on Sales of iPhone 5
headline.print_headline: Apple Profit Rises 24% On Sales Of iPhone 5

snippet: Random House, owned by Bertlesmann, and Penguin, owned by Pearson, are negotiating a merger that would create a publisher that would control 25 percent of the American book market.
abstract: Random House, owned by Bertlesmann, and Penguin, owned by Pearson, are negotiating a merger that would create a publisher that would control 25 percent of the American book market.

headline.main: Random House and Penguin Are Negotiating a Merger
headline.print_headline: Random House and Penguin Negotiating a Merger

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and ERIC PFANNER

snippet: A long-awaited restaurant serving smorrebrod is set to open in TriBeCa on Nov. 2.
abstract: A long-awaited restaurant serving smorrebrod is set to open in TriBeCa on Nov. 2.

snippet: Microsoft threw a coming-out party for Windows 8 and the Surface tablet, presenting new devices from its hardware partners that will run Windows 8.
abstract: Microsoft threw a coming-out party for Windows 8 and the Surface tablet, presenting new devices from its hardware partners that will run Windows 8.

headline.main: Updates From Microsoft's Windows 8 and Surface Event

snippet: A string of prominent earnings disappointments pointed to weak global demand and sapped buying enthusiasm after what had been a strong run in 2012.
abstract: Stocks end with small gains as worries about weak business spending deter investors.

snippet: Rajat K. Gupta gets a two-year prison sentence for leaking boardroom secrets to Raj Rajaratnam. | Federal prosecutors sue Bank of America over a mortgage program. | The incoming chairman of Barclays plans "a clean sweep" of the board.
abstract: Rajat K. Gupta gets a two-year prison sentence for leaking boardroom secrets to Raj Rajaratnam. | Federal prosecutors sue Bank of America over a mortgage program. | The incoming chairman of Barclays plans "a clean sweep" of the board.

headline.main: A Big Insider Trading Scalp, and a Challenge

snippet: There are ways to holding a phone still while taking a picture to reduce blurry photographs.
abstract: There are ways to holding a phone still while taking a picture to reduce blurry photographs.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Steady That Phone-Camera Shot
